course.subject: CSC
course.title: Object Oriented Applications and Program Development
course.catalogDescription: This course emphasizes the application of Object Oriented Programming (OOP) concepts in the java programming language to large-scale programming problems. The course includes application of techniques such as the Unified Modeling Language (UML).

objectives.objective: Be able to design and implement object-oriented programs in Java, using a large sub-set of the language effectively.
Have knowledge of key object-oriented principles and design strategies.
Understand how core data structures are implemented.
Be able to use programming tools such as an integrated development environment (IDE), debugger, and code repository.
Be able to design, document and implement the software for a real-world client application, which could be a mobile app, cloud app or web services.
Be able to design and implement graphical user interfaces suitable for scaling on multiple devices and resolutions.
Have experience of effective team work methods and project organization skills.
Have experience of interacting with a real client..

outline.topic: Using abstract classes, interfaces and inheritance.
Principles of graphical user interface design and implementation.
Working as an effective software development team
Preparing project timelines and document templates.
